Key Match Events: Alperen Sengun had 25 points and 14 rebounds, helping the Houston Rockets secure a 109-97 win over the New York Knicks.
Sengun scored 10 points in the final period to help the Rockets put the game away.
Fred VanVleet added 19 points for Houston and Jalen Green had 15.
Jalen Brunson led the Knicks with 29 points and OG Anunoby added 21.
Karl-Anthony Towns had 17 points and a season-high 19 rebounds.
The Rockets led by three before a soaring, two-handed dunk by Amen Thompson followed by a 3 from Green made it 105-97 with less than a minute to go.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks need to do a better job of scoring inside with Towns, as they were outscored 62-38 in the paint.
The Rockets did a good job of getting several players involved offensively, with four starters finishing in double figures and Amen Thompson adding 12 points off the bench.
The Rockets need to find a way to be more consistent throughout games, as they squandered a double-digit lead before pulling away late.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets won despite making just 8 of 33 3-pointers, with Green starting out 0 for 6 and finishing 2 of 8, and VanVleet and Jabari Smith Jr. each making just 1 of 5 attempts.
Others: The Knicks visit the Hawks on Wednesday night and the Rockets host the Spurs that night.
